summary: This document is an email chain from August 18, 2020, between legal parties discussing discovery requests in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails focus on obtaining specific evidence from the FBI, including grand jury transcripts, message pad scans, search warrant returns, and digital evidence from seized devices. The correspondence highlights the ongoing process of evidence review and production.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The discovery requests discussed in the emails are related to her criminal case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation involves evidence seized from his properties.

connections.description: The discovery requests pertain to evidence from the joint investigation into their alleged activities.

events.title: Discovery Request Follow-up
events.description: Legal team sends detailed follow-up questions and requests for evidence from the FBI, including grand jury transcripts, message pad scans, and search warrant returns.

keyFacts: The document references a disc labeled as containing grand jury transcripts, indicating their existence and potential relevance.
Specific search warrants are mentioned (e.g., '20 mag 6719 warrant', 'NH premises warrant'), and their returns are reportedly missing.
The FBI conducted a large scanning project of all paper evidence vouchered, including message pads scanned with and without post-it notes.
Requests include the 'Full FBI sentinel file', CART paperwork for device data extraction, and all related FBI 302s.
Special procedures are requested for handling nude or partially nude images, requiring logs instead of direct production.
